metadata.title: CVE-2018-5141 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the notifications Push API where notifications can besent through service workers by web content without direct userinteraction. This could be used to open new tabs in a denial of service(DOS) attack or to display unwanted content from arbitrary URLs to users.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
